idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850. Arc/Info coverage format t:\home\gis1\benb\watershed\h2oshed

descript.abstract: This data set represents the extent of the Kachemak Bay watershed, including the Bay, all waters flowing into it, and the entire Anchor River basin. The boundary was delineated and digitized using 1:63,360 USGS topographic maps.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this data is to provide a consistent watershed boundary for purposes that include planning and resource management at the watershed level.
descript.supplinf: This data layer includes information digitized from the following 1:63,360 USGS topographic maps: Seldovia quads B3-B6, C1-C3, D1-D5, and Kenai quads A2 and A3.

citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Fish and Game
citeinfo.title: Kachemak Bay Watershed - KBEC Database

pubinfo.publish: Alaska Department of Fish and Game

idinfo.accconst: Users must assume responsibility to determine the usability of this data for their purposes. These data are public information and provided for general visual reference and to aid users in generating various natural resource analyses and products. To ensure distribution of the most current public information, please refer requests for data or products to the Alaska Department of Fish and Game, Habitat and Restoration Division (see Distribution_Information Section).
idinfo.useconst: One should not use the data at a scale larger than 1:63,360. Any hardcopies utilizing these data sets shall clearly indicate their source. If the user has modified the data in any way, they are obligated to describe the types of modifications they have performed on the hardcopy map. User specifically agrees not to misrepresent these data sets, nor to imply that the Alaska Department of Fish and Game approved the changes they made. There are no security restrictions on these electronic files once they leave ADF&G. Consequently, they should not be relied upon, nor used for making regulatory decisions regarding permitting or use.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attracc.attraccr: Arc attributes were computer generated in ARC/INFO, with the exception of the user defined field SOURCE, that lists the derivation for each arc.

dataqual.complete: This coverage is a complete representation of the Kachemak Bay watershed, based on current USGS topographical knowledge.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy was tested by comparing the data with 1:63,360 USGS digital raster graphics (DRG's) (i.e., scanned topographic maps). Manual delineation of a watershed boundary can be rather subjective, especially in areas that are relatively flat, and where two or more glaciers originate. Thus, where applicable, the data were also compared to other digital watershed representations (e.g., USGS Hydrologic Unit Code data, Cook Inlet Keeper's watershed boundary data). The digitizing RMS error was <= 0.004 map inches.

procstep.procdesc: The watershed boundary was manually drawn on paper copies of 1:63,360 USGS topographic maps. The resulting line was digitized into an ARC/INFO coverage, using stream mode with weed tolerance = 5, and nodesnap = 20. The digitizing RMS error was <= 0.004 map inches. This process was carried out for each of the 14 quadrangles covered. The digitized arcs were combined using the PUT command and INTERSECTARCS ALL within ARCEDIT. Any extraneous arcs were removed. In order to create a polygon, several coastline arcs were taken from the COAST63 coverage, and a single arc was drawn from Anchor Point to Point Pogibshi, to represent the mouth of the bay.
